PreparerUSAddress.AddressLine1Txt: MILLIKEN PLACE 107 S CASS STE A

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE COUNCIL OF MICHIGAN FOUNDATIONS' (CMF) MISSION IS TO GROW THE IMPACT OF MICHIGAN PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO GROW THE IMPACT OF MICHIGAN PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.Desc: CMF HAS AN OFFICE IN LANSING THAT WORKS DIRECTLY WITH THE GOVERNOR OF MICHIGAN. THE OFFICE OF FOUNDATION LIAISON WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2003 TO MANAGE STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN FOUNDATIONS AND STATE GOVERNMENT TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF MICHIGAN CITIZENS. FUNDED BY FOUNDATIONS THE OFFICE OF THREE STAFF IS LOCATED IN LANSING WITH DIRECT ACCESS TO THE GOVERNOR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF IMPACTMICHIGAN IS TO PROVIDE THE SERVICES NEEDED FOR THE SOCIAL SECTOR TO IMPROVE OUTCOMES FOR THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. TO ACHIEVE THIS, IMPACTMICHIGAN IS A SYSTEM THAT COLLECTS DATA FROM GOVERNMENT, FOUNDATIONS AND NONPROFITS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT/OUTCOMES OF PROGRAMS SERVICING THOSE MOST IN NEED. THE SYSTEM WILL HELP HIGHLIGHT PROGRAMS THAT ARE MOST EFFECTIVE SO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS CAN USE THAT KNOWLEDGE TO INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THEIR OWN PROGRAMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: WITH FOUNDATIONS' INCREASING INTEREST IN THE IMPACT INVESTING AREA, CMF CONVENED A TASK FORCE AND SURVEYED MEMBERS ON BARRIERS TO IMPACT INVESTING. AS A RESULT OF MEMBER INTEREST MORGAN STANLEY AND COMMUNITY CAPITAL MANAGEMENT CREATED A FUND DESIGNED TO ADDRESS FOUNDATION BARRIERS TO IMPACT INVESTING. CMF WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AROUND, AND ENCOURAGEMENT OF, IMPACT INVESTING, THROUGH OUR COLLABORATION WITH MISSION INVESTORS EXCHANGE AND OTHERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: WITH AN INITIAL INVESTMENT OF $500,000 FROM THE KRESGE FOUNDATION IN EARLY 2010, CMF LAUNCHED THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION CHALLENGE GRANT TO ENCOURAGE MICHIGAN COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS TO EXPAND, ENHANCE, STRENGTHEN AND SUSTAIN THEIR LOCAL COLLEGE ACCESS PARTNERSHIPS. CMF BELIEVES THAT COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS ARE IDEAL CANDIDATES TO SUPPORT LOCAL COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAMS BECAUSE OF THEIR LONG-STANDING SUPPORT OF COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS, THEIR LEADERSHIP AND COMMITMENT TO MCAN EFFORTS, AND THEIR POSITION AS VITAL LEADERS IN MICHIGAN'S COMMUNITIES. THE PURPOSE OF THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION CHALLENGE GRANT INITIATIVE IS TO LEVERAGE LOCAL PRIVATE INVESTMENT TO ENGAGE AND SUSTAIN COLLEGE ACCESS PARTNERSHIPS, THEREBY INCREASING THE COLLEGE-GOING RATE AND CULTURE IN MICHIGAN.

AS A MEMBERSHIP ASSOCIATION OF FOUNDATIONS & CORPORATE GIVING PROGRAMS CMF PROVIDES RESOURCES TO MEMBERS THROUGH ITS WEBSITE, SEMINARS, CONFERENCES AND PUBLICATIONS. CMF IS ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN ADVOCACY ON BEHALF OF FOUNDATIONS & CORPORATE GIVING PROGRAMS REGARDING LEGISLATIVE & REGULATORY ISSUES THAT AFFECT CHARITABLE GIVING & THE NONPROFIT SECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCOME TAXES CMF AND ITS SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONS, MCFV, CMFSO AND LTG, ARE NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND ARE ALSO EXEMPT FROM SIMILAR STATE AND LOCAL TAXES. ALTHOUGH THE ORGANIZATION WAS GRANTED INCOME TAX EXEMPTION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, SUCH EXEMPTION DOES NOT APPLY TO "UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME." SUCH INCOME, PURSUANT TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND RELATED REGULATIONS, INCLUDES INVESTMENT INCOME. THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION ANALYZES ITS INCOME TAX FILING POSITIONS IN THE FEDERAL AND STATE JURISDICTIONS WHERE IT IS REQUIRED TO FILE INCOME TAX RETURNS, AS WELL AS ALL OPEN TAX YEARS IN THESE JURISDICTIONS, TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION TREATS INTEREST AND PENALTIES ATTRIBUTABLE TO INCOME TAXES, AND REFLECTS ANY CHARGES FOR SUCH, TO THE EXTENT THEY ARISE, AS A COMPONENT OF ITS MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS EVALUATED ITS INCOME TAX FILING POSITIONS FOR FISCAL YEARS 2013 THROUGH 2016, THE YEARS WHICH REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION AS OF MARCH 31, 2016. THE ORGANIZATION CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING RECOGNITION IN THE ORGANIZATION'S CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT EXPECT THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS ("UTB") (E.G. TAX DEDUCTIONS, EXCLUSIONS, OR CREDITS CLAIMED OR EXPECTED TO BE CLAIMED) TO SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGE IN THE NEXT TWELVE MONTHS. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED FOR INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UTBS AT MARCH 31, 2016 AND 2015, AND IS NOT AWARE OF ANY CLAIMS FOR SUCH AMOUNTS BY FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAX AUTHORITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CMF COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HIRED MERCER IN 2015 TO PROVIDE A COMPENSATION STUDY OF ALL MANAGEMENT STAFF AT CMF, INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT. THIS STUDY WAS USED AS A BASIS FOR THE PRESIDENT'S CURRENT SALARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE MEMBERSHIPS WITH CMF ARE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS OR INDIVIDUALS ANNUALLY ELECT NEW MEMBERS TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY THE CMF BOARD RECEIVES A COPY OF THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING, WITH A MEMO FROM THE CFO HIGHLIGHTING KEY INFORMATION IN THE FORM. TRUSTEES ARE INSTRUCTED TO CONTACT THE CFO IF THEY HAVE ANY COMMENTS OR QUESTIONS ABOUT INFORMATION IN THE FORM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY TRUSTEES AND EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONAIRE. IF ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT WAS NOTED CMF LEGAL COUNSEL WOULD BE CONTACTED REGARDING STEPS NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN 2015 THE CMF BOARD COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HIRED MERCER TO PROVIDE A FOLLOW UP COMPENSATION STUDY OF ALL MANAGEMENT STAFF INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT. THIS STUDY WAS USED AS THE BASIS FOR THE CURRENT COMPENSATION PACKAGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CMF'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. CMF'S ANNUAL AUDIT IS AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.MICHIGANFOUNDATIONS.ORG

PROGRAM CONSULTANTS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 918,961. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 26,162. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 945,123. PROGRAM EVALUATION: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 12,375. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 12,375.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
